text: William Sturgeon exhibited the electromagnet in a practical form for the first time. The exhibition accompanied the reading of a paper, recorded in the Transactions of the Society of Arts for 1825 (Vol xliii, p.38).
John Bardeen was born. He grew up to become to win the Nobel Prize twice, once for inventing the transistor, and once for figuring out superconductivity.
Sun Microsystems Inc. announced the programming language Java and the accompanying Web browser HotJava at the SunWorld '95 convention.
